segments.text: Hello , come in , I've been waiting for you .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Than you , I'm not late , am I ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , no , no , not at all.It ' s just that I've been looking forward to meeting you .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , thank you , but it's not all that hard to do , you know . I've been calling your office and sending you proposals for about two years now , and you've never responded before .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Ha , ha , ha ! Yes , I guess I deserved that . Let me explain , okay ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , as you probably know I buy from a selected group of suppliers and don't , as a rule , deal with new people .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I know that . It's why Ive been trying to become one of those suppliers . I hear you're a good man to do business with .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'm very old-fashioned . I believe in loyalty.Once I start a sales relationship with someone , I stay with him or her , and we so most of our business on the phone . I expect their absolute best price possible and don't haggle.But if I find out they screwed me over , then I find another supplier .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's pretty much what I heard .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , those are my terms . As long as you honor them , we do business.If you break faith and try to take advantage , I'll find someone else to work with . Can you live with that ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No problem at all , Mike . Just give me the chance .
segments.speaker: S2
